value: Rocaille (rococo design), in Nouveaux morceaux pour des paravents (New concepts for screens)

label: Description
value: A shell-work fountain on a mound of rockwork in the foreground, with two monkeys at the left. In the background, a temple portico houses another fountain, with vase and pyramid beside it.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait in three-quarter view towards right. The sitter is standing, leaning on his left arm. Inscribed, lower left: "Cav Capalti dip"; center: "Prof Valeri dis"; lower right: "L. Ceroni inc."; below: dedication to Cardinal Giuseppe Mezzofanti in Italian.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in crayon manner on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
A Bombardment That Would Paralyze Them

label: Description
value: A settlement of four houses in foreground is bombed with soap products, towels, water barrels, etc. from a fortress background. People are running out from houses in panic. Illustration for back cover of Puck, Vol. XIII, No. 319, April 18, 1883.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of the seated man. His body in side view towards right, his head in three-quarter view also to right. He holds in his right hand a book. The portrait is surrounded by a rococo frame with an inscribed plaquette.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Portrait of Joseph Aurelius de Januario

label: Description
value: Half-length in three-quarter view toward right. The sitter is wearing a wig and a dark robe. The portrait is enclosed by an oval frame which imitates a window in a stone wall. Below the frame a small pedestal with inscription.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Portrait of the head in side view towards left. The portrait imitates a relief.

value: Line and stipple engraving on paper

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Shoulder-length portrait in three-quarter view towards right. Callot is bareheaded, and wears a suit with a wide collar.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Portrait of Antonius Triest, Bishop of Ghent

label: Description
value: Instead of the half-length portrait by van Dyck, Polanzani has engraved only the head, which is in reverse from the engraving by Van Dyck. The sitter's face is in three-quarter view towards left. Draperies around the neck.

label: Description
value: Two sides of a medal: the top side shows a portrait in side view inscribed. Bottom side shows seated Athena writing.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Vertical oval in vertical rectangle. Half-length portrait in side view to left. The sitter is with a bare head; he wears a dark closed coat. The portrait is in an oval frame decorated with a ribbon and laurel sprigs. Below the frame, a plaquette with inscription: macte. hoc. honore Josephe Zola....M.DCC. XCIII.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait in three-quarter view to right. A middle-aged man with long white hair, wearing a closed coat. The portrait is encircled by a frame decorated with olive-sprigs and a ribbon above; olive-wreath below which connects the frame with an inscribed plaquette.

label: Physical description
value: Line and stipple engraving on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Portrait of Dr. Juan Caramuel de Loblokowitz

label: Description
value: Portrait bust in frontal view. The sitter, an old man, is wearing a cardinal's cap, a scholar's jacket and a coat over his left shoulder. The portrait is in an oval frame which rests on a pedestal. On the right, a mitre and a book, left a book and an inkwell with pens. over the upper left corner of the frame hangs a drapery.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Portrait bust shown in lying position. Head at right in side view. Marat's head covered with a scarf of which a part is on the pillow. He is wearing a dark coat with a white narrow scarf. The portrait is encircled by an oval frame inserted into a rectangular shaded field.

label: Physical description
value: Line and stipple engraving on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Portrait bust of an old bearded man in frontal view. His head tilted slightly forward and to right. He wears a closed coat with a small collar.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Four separate designs for festival gondolas of which most are carrying pavilions and decorated with draperies. Inscriptions under each design.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of the middle-aged cardinal. his head facing frontally, the body turned slightly towards right. The Cardinal wears skull-cap and cape. Above the oval frame: Coat of arms of the Cardinal at right, at left, Pope Clement XI.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

Portrait of Charles J. F. Henault (1685-1770)

label: Description
value: The bust-length portrait is in side view to left and is in a medallion attached with a bow to a panelled rectangular board. The sitter is wearing a wig, a dark jacket with a white tie. Below the portrait is a plaquette with the artists' names inscribed thereon.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Bust portrait in three-quarter view turned to right. In an oval frame with the coat-of-arms on the lower part. It stands on a moulding on which are inscribed the artists' names. Below, an inscribed plaquette.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum
